metadata.title: MHF4U - L1.6 Slope of Tangent and Instantaneous Rate of Change
metadata.creator: Asseel
metadata.abstract: This document is for testing purposes only. The material that is presented here should be treated as an example only.

stack.p: Amanda Koon
MHF4U

The history of mathematics presents the development of calculus as being accredited to Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727) an English physicist, mathematician and Gottfried Wilhelm Leibnitz (1646-1716) a German physicist, mathematician.

The introduction of calculus created an explosion in the development of the physical sciences and other areas of science as calculus provided a way of describing natural and physical laws in a mathematical format which is easily understood. The development of calculus also opened new areas of mathematics and science as individuals sought out new ways to apply the techniques of calculus.

Calculus is the study of things that change and finding ways to represent these changes in a mathematical way. The symbol will be used to represent change. For example, the notation is to be read the change in (height).

A secant line is defined by a straight line passing through two points on a curve. In general, we can define these points as having coordinates and . The slope of the secant line, given by is given by:

image.alt: m_{s} = \frac{ \bigtriangleup y}{ \bigtriangleup x} = \frac{f(x + \bigtriangleup x) - f(x)}{x + \bigtriangleup x - x} = \frac{f(x + \bigtriangleup x) - f(x)}{\bigtriangleup x }

stack.p: The secant line represents the Average Rate of Change between two points on a function.

slider.name: aSlider
bSlider

stack.p:
As the point A approaches point B, the quantity approaches zero, the secant line approaches the tangent line at point B. Additionally, also approaches zero as A gets closer to B.
One way to approzimate the slope of a tangent is to find the slope between the tangent point and another point that is very close to the tangent point, .
The tangent line at point A represents the Instantaneous Rate of Change of the function at A.

c) Estimate the rate at which the diver's height above the water is changing as the diver enters the water.

stack.name: ans
stack.p: To answer this question we have to use two points. One at and another point that is right next to it; like . This way, we can calculate instantaneous rate of change.
